p.em: All Students Learning at High Levels

div.data-code: <iframe src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/page.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FClay-County-Schools-Hayesville-NC-453607465219318%2F&tabs=timeline&width=340&height=500&small_header=true&adapt_container_width=true&hide_cover=false&show_facepile=true&appId" width="340" height="500" style="border:none;overflow:hidden" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowTransparency="true" allow="encrypted-media"></iframe>

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.p: The Clay County School System is located in the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina. It is a small, rural school system of approximately 1,485 students. There are three schools in the county located on a single campus. Hayesville Elementary is a PK-4 school of approximately 625 students. Hayesville Middle School is a 5-8 school with approximately 450 students and Hayesville High School is a 9-12 school with approximately 399 students. All schools are accredited by the North Carolina State Board of Education and the Department of Public Instruction. Hayesville High School is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Our schools are committed to constantly improving the safety of our students and staff. In doing so we have trained all of our students in grades 5-12 to recognize the signs of at-risk behaviors and to utilize the states new anonymous reporting system. Below you will find more information about this program.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: 154 Yellow Jacket Drive | Hayesville, NC 28904 | Phone (828) 389-8513 | Fax (828) 389-3437

div.small: Clay County Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color or national origin, sex or disability in any student program.

It is the policy of the Board of Education to comply fully with the requirements of Title VI, Title IX, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act and all accompanying regulations.

small.em: Clay County Schools is in the process of reviewing its website to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. If you have questions or concerns regarding the accessibility of the website or if you are unable to access a page or document on the website, you may contact the Technology Department/Adrian Jefferies via email at ajefferies@clayschools.org or by phone at 828-389-8513.
